titleproper.value: Guide to the Collection of African Colonial Collectible Sticker Albums <num>TAM.776</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-02-27T14:40:10</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Collection of African Colonial Collectible Sticker Albums

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box, 1 half manuscript box, 1 flat box and 2 oversize flat folders

abstract.value: The materials in this collection are primarily albums to hold collectible stickers and stamps. Some of the albums were made by corporations as promotional and educational tools to market their products. The albums all depict life, people, and landscapes of European colonies in Africa, with the bulk of albums focused on the Democratic Republic of Congo (formerly known as the Belgian Congo).

p.value: Identification of item, date; Collection of African Colonial Collectible Sticker Albums; TAM 776; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
There is no documentation concerning the acquisition of these materials. The accession number associated with this collection is 2019.014.

The collection also includes an undated poster for a student protest of colonialism, a promotional poster about rubber plantations in the Belgian Congo, and three prints illustrating life in the colonies of Kenya and Rhodesia.
